title: Drawing, Design for China Cabinet of Mahogany in Elevation and Plan, 1900–05
title_raw: Design for China Cabinet of Mahogany in Elevation and Plan
medium: Graphite and yellow color pencil on thin cream paper
markings: Watermark across verso bottom : ORIENTAL LINEN
signed: Impressed, lower left of center: RETURN TO / A.H. DAVENPORT CO. / 96 WASHINGTON ST./ BOSTON MASS.
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite upper left of elevation:Back lined with velvet; at upper right of elevation: Three adjustable wood shelves; at lower center of elevation: Brass shoe; below elevation, right: CHINA CABINET OF MAHOGANY; at center top and center right of elevation, numerical notations indicating dimensions; at lower left of plan: Door; at center below plan: PLAN; at center of plan, numerical notations indicating dimensions; at lower right of sheet: $125.-; in lower right corner of sheet: #70 [underlined].
creditline: Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society
description: Elevation: rectangular tri-partite front with glass door and 3 shelves raised on 4 straight tapering legs.  Plan: semi-circular cabinet top with flattened central front with details indicated in yellow color pencil.

participants.person_name: The Lake St. Louis Historical Society

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for China Cabinet of Mahogany in Elevation and Plan, 1900–05. Graphite and yellow color pencil on thin cream paper. 
Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society. 2000-69-204.
